'''Gilfanon''' was an [[Solosimpi|Elf]] of [[Alqaluntë]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in a prose fragment following ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name=Prose/>

== History ==
When [[Fëanor]] marched with the [[Gnomes]] upon [[Cú nan Eilch]], Gilfanon was one of the [[Solosimpi]] who fought against them when he saw his swan-feather boat being stolen. He, along with his sons, threatened the Gnomes, and in the ensuing fight, he was thrown into the sea, but not before uttering a curse.<ref name=Prose>{{SM|P3}}, pp. 9-10</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In ''The Book of Lost Tales'' there appears another character called '''[[Gilfanon]]''', who was a Gnome of [[Tavrobel]], but [[Christopher Tolkien]] is certain that the two are entirely separate characters, and that the ''Gilfanon'' of Tavrobel had probably ceased to be named as such at this point in the legendarium.<ref name=Prose/>
